title: The journal of Sir Walter Scott,
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: My two girls met me at Torsonce, which was a pleasant surprise, and we returned in the sociable all together.

title: The journal of Sir Walter Scott,
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: My two girls met me at Torsonce, which was a pleasant surprise, and we returned in the sociable all together.

title: Journal of a tour through the Highlands of Scotland during the summer of MDCCCXXIX.
author: Botfield, Beriah
snippet: Quiet pastoral scenery is all it presents to the eyes of the traveller, untU, beyond the village of Stow and the innof Torsonce, it terminates in moorish uplands,upon crossing which the dark ridge of the Pentland Hills, and the fair and fertile expanse ofthe Lothians, first met our view ; and whence wedescended, entering the vale, of which an openingto the right discloses the massive ruins of Borthwick Castle.
